synopsis: In episode #8, Devam and Ahir engage in a candid discussion about motivation, mental health, and personal growth with their guest, Ganesh Ramakrishnan. The trio shares their experiences with anxiety, procrastination, and the importance of self-compassion, while exploring how to navigate life's challenges with humor and authenticity.
quotes: You realize how many times you failed a test this past year? You're a freshman in college. People don't fail shit like that.
It's not about the words, it's about the fact that you even try.
Sometimes you just need to wiggle your toe.
Motivation isn’t going to strike you; you have to make it happen.
Procrastination is not an issue about being lazy; it's an emotional regulation issue.
The mind needs to be shown what's possible, so you just need to do it, and your mind will follow.
You have to trust the process and that means fundamentally trusting yourself.
If you can get yourself out of bed today, that's a win.
The biggest way to approach this is based off of what sounds interesting to you.
Even if you can’t get out of bed any faster than this, I know I'm trying my hardest.
